metadata.Title: CVE-2013-1591 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in libpixman, as used in Pale Moon before 15.4 and possibly other products, has unspecified impact and context-dependent attack vectors.  NOTE: this issue might be resultant from an integer overflow in the fast_composite_scaled_bilinear function in pixman-inlines.h, which triggers an infinite loop.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-1591` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpixman-1-0 - 0.28.2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> reduced to low for stack-protector mdeslaur> patch below seems to be difference between Pale Moon 15.3.2 and 15.4

criterions.comment: pixman package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.28.2-0ubuntu1').
